episodeTitle: Straw Hat Team Arrives! Tension Grows at the Battlefield
description: Luffy and the Impel Down escapees arrive at Marineford, crashing into the battlefield. Luffy stops Crocodile from attacking Whitebeard and boldly declares his intention to become Pirate King. Jinbe formally resigns from the Shichibukai, while the Marines, Admirals, and Warlords react to the unexpected arrivals with shock and concern.

events.title: Luffy and Impel Down Escapees Arrive at Marineford
events.description: Luffy and the escaped prisoners from Impel Down crash into the battlefield at Marineford, arriving on a stolen Marine battleship that falls from the frozen tsunami wave. The group includes Luffy, Jinbe, Emporio Ivankov, Crocodile, Buggy, Mr. 3 (Galdino), Mr. 1 (Daz Bonez), and 233 other prisoners.
events.significance: This marks the historic first mass breakout from Impel Down and brings powerful allies to the battlefield. Luffy's arrival completely shifts the dynamics of the war and brings hope to the rescue mission for Ace.

events.title: Luffy and Ace Spot Each Other
events.description: As Luffy climbs on top of the wrecked Marine battleship, he and Ace see each other for the first time since Luffy began his rescue mission. Ace calls out Luffy's name in shock and concern, while Luffy responds happily.
events.significance: This emotional reunion moment shows the bond between the brothers and emphasizes what's at stake. Ace's concern reflects his desire for Luffy not to risk his life, while Luffy's determination shows he won't abandon his brother.

quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace calling out to his brother upon seeing him arrive at Marineford

events.title: Marines Recognize the Impel Down Escapees
events.description: The Marines begin identifying the escaped prisoners, recognizing Crocodile (former Shichibukai), Jinbe (current Shichibukai), Emporio Ivankov (Revolutionary Army commander), and other infamous pirates from Impel Down. Sengoku is horrified while Garp remains in shock.
events.significance: The recognition of these powerful criminals highlights the catastrophic security failure at Impel Down and the unprecedented nature of Luffy's prison break. The presence of a Revolutionary Army commander also escalates the political implications of the battle.

events.title: Shichibukai React to Luffy's Arrival
events.description: The Warlords of the Sea react to Luffy's arrival with varying responses: Mihawk shows subtle surprise and notes Luffy's disruptive nature, Hancock blushes in relief seeing that Luffy is alive, Doflamingo finds amusement in the chaos, Moria shows rage, and Kuma remains silent.
events.significance: These varied reactions showcase the different personalities and motivations of the Warlords, with Hancock's concern revealing her feelings for Luffy and the others recognizing him as a significant threat or curiosity.

events.title: Admiral Aokiji Comments on Luffy's Allies
events.description: Admiral Aokiji observes that Luffy has brought along tough allies, recognizing the significant power boost the escaped prisoners represent.
events.significance: An Admiral acknowledging the strength of Luffy's allies demonstrates how the balance of power at Marineford has shifted with their arrival.

quotes.text: Luffy has brought along tough allies.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Admiral Aokiji commenting on the escaped prisoners from Impel Down

events.title: Smoker and Tashigi Shocked by Luffy-Crocodile Alliance
events.description: Smoker and Tashigi are bewildered seeing Luffy and Crocodile working together, given their history as enemies during the Alabasta arc.
events.significance: This highlights how desperate the situation is and how unlikely alliances have formed. It also shows the magnitude of the threat that would cause former bitter enemies to cooperate.

events.title: Crocodile Attempts to Attack Whitebeard
events.description: Emporio Ivankov notices that Crocodile has vanished from the group. Crocodile suddenly appears behind Whitebeard, attempting to impale him with his golden hook in a surprise assassination attempt.
events.significance: This reveals that despite the temporary alliance, Crocodile still has his own agenda and seeks to take down Whitebeard, one of the Four Emperors. It shows Crocodile's opportunistic and treacherous nature.

events.title: Luffy Stops Crocodile with Gear Second Water Kick
events.description: Luffy intercepts Crocodile's attack on Whitebeard by activating Gear Second and delivering a powerful kick to Crocodile's face. Crucially, Luffy's leg is coated with water, exploiting Crocodile's Devil Fruit weakness to the Suna Suna no Mi.
events.significance: This demonstrates Luffy's strategic thinking and his memory of Crocodile's weakness from their previous battles. It also shows Luffy's resolve to protect Whitebeard because he is important to Ace.

quotes.text: If the giant old man was indeed Whitebeard, no one was touching him as the Emperor was the only person Ace truly cared about.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy explaining to Crocodile why he protected Whitebeard

events.title: Luffy and Whitebeard Meet Face-to-Face
events.description: Luffy and Whitebeard meet for the first time. Whitebeard immediately recognizes Luffy's straw hat as the one that once belonged to Shanks. He recalls Shanks telling him about betting his arm on 'the New Age.'
events.significance: This is a monumental meeting between the future Pirate King and one of the strongest pirates of the current era. Whitebeard's recognition of the straw hat connects Luffy to Shanks and the legacy he carries, emphasizing the symbolic importance of the hat.

events.title: Whitebeard Recalls Shanks' Words About the New Age
events.description: When Whitebeard sees Luffy's straw hat and recognizes it as belonging to Shanks, he remembers Shanks telling him about betting his arm on a bet on 'the New Age.'
events.significance: This flashback connects important moments in One Piece history, showing that Shanks saw something special in Luffy from the very beginning and that his sacrifice was a deliberate investment in the future of piracy.

quotes.text: I bet it on the New Age.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Flashback to Shanks explaining to Whitebeard why he sacrificed his arm

events.title: Luffy Declares He Will Become Pirate King to Whitebeard
events.description: When Whitebeard asks if Luffy is here to save Ace and warns him that he will die attempting the rescue, Luffy defiantly tells Whitebeard to stop telling him what to do. He then boldly declares that he will surpass Whitebeard and become the Pirate King.
events.significance: This is one of the most audacious moments in the series, with Luffy directly challenging a Yonko and declaring his dream in front of the entire battlefield. His fearlessness and determination stun everyone present, including the most powerful individuals in the world.

quotes.text: Don't tell me what to do! I'm going to become the Pirate King!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's bold declaration to Whitebeard in front of the entire battlefield

events.title: Battlefield Stunned by Luffy's Declaration
events.description: The entire battlefield falls silent and is stunned by Luffy's audacious declaration to become Pirate King. Pirates, Marines, and Warlords alike are shocked by his boldness in directly challenging Whitebeard.
events.significance: This moment shows how Luffy's fearless nature and unwavering conviction can shock even the most hardened warriors. It establishes Luffy as someone who cannot be intimidated, regardless of who stands before him.

events.title: Whitebeard Acknowledges Luffy's Determination
events.description: Whitebeard responds to Luffy's bold declaration by stating that he won't forgive Luffy if he gets in his way, but implicitly accepts that they share the same goal of rescuing Ace. Luffy responds that he will do as he pleases and will save Ace.
events.significance: This establishes a temporary understanding between Luffy and Whitebeard. While they have different ultimate goals, they both want to save Ace, creating an alliance of necessity and mutual respect.

quotes.text: I'll do as I please, and I'll save Ace!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

events.title: Jinbe Formally Resigns from the Shichibukai
events.description: Jinbe officially announces to Fleet Admiral Sengoku that he is resigning his position as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea. He states that he is fine with this choice and will support the rescue of Ace.
events.significance: Jinbe's resignation is a significant political move that weakens the World Government's power structure. It shows his loyalty to Whitebeard and his principles over his official position, and adds another powerful ally to Luffy's side.

quotes.text: Sengoku! I resign from my position as a Warlord of the Sea!
quotes.speaker: Jinbe

events.title: Akainu Identifies Luffy as Dragon's Son
events.description: Admiral Akainu identifies Luffy as the son of the Revolutionary Dragon and the grandson of Vice Admiral Garp. He declares that Luffy must be eliminated because of his dangerous lineage.
events.significance: This revelation highlights Luffy's dangerous bloodline and marks him as a high-priority target for the World Government. It connects him to the Revolutionary Army leader and shows why the Marines view him as such a significant threat beyond his actions.

quotes.text: That boy is the son of Dragon and grandson of Garp! He must be eliminated!
quotes.speaker: Akainu

events.title: Koby and Helmeppo React to Luffy's Arrival
events.description: Koby and Helmeppo are amazed and shocked at the fact that Luffy has broken out of Impel Down and arrived at Marineford with powerful allies.
events.significance: This shows how far Luffy has come since his early days when he first met Koby. It also demonstrates the conflicted feelings Koby has, as Luffy is both his friend and an enemy of the Marines.

quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace seeing his brother arrive at Marineford

quotes.text: Luffy has brought along tough allies.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Admiral Aokiji commenting on the escaped prisoners

quotes.text: If the giant old man was indeed Whitebeard, no one was touching him as the Emperor was the only person Ace truly cared about.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy explaining why he protected Whitebeard from Crocodile

quotes.text: I bet it on the New Age.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Flashback to Shanks explaining to Whitebeard why he sacrificed his arm

quotes.text: Don't tell me what to do! I'm going to become the Pirate King!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: I'll do as I please, and I'll save Ace!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Sengoku! I resign from my position as a Warlord of the Sea!
quotes.speaker: Jinbe

quotes.text: That boy is the son of Dragon and grandson of Garp! He must be eliminated!
quotes.speaker: Akainu

themes.description: The episode strongly emphasizes the concept of inherited will through Luffy's straw hat, which Whitebeard recognizes as belonging to Shanks. The flashback to Shanks' statement about betting on the New Age shows how the older generation passes their dreams and ambitions to the next generation.
themes.symbolism: The straw hat represents Shanks' trust in Luffy and the promise of a new era of piracy. Whitebeard's recognition of it symbolizes the acknowledgment from the old guard that Luffy represents the future.

themes.description: The episode showcases how desperate circumstances create unlikely partnerships. Luffy works alongside former enemies like Crocodile and Buggy, while protecting Whitebeard despite being rivals for the title of Pirate King.
themes.symbolism: The diverse group of Impel Down escapees symbolizes how shared goals can temporarily unite even bitter enemies.

themes.description: Luffy's bold declaration to become Pirate King directly to Whitebeard's face, in front of the most powerful forces in the world, demonstrates his unwavering courage and refusal to be intimidated regardless of the circumstances.
themes.symbolism: Luffy challenging Whitebeard symbolizes the new generation's fearlessness and willingness to compete with the established order.

themes.description: The emotional reunion between Luffy and Ace, combined with Luffy's determination to save his brother at any cost, emphasizes the power of familial bonds. Luffy's protection of Whitebeard is also motivated by his importance to Ace.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's journey through Impel Down and arrival at Marineford symbolizes the lengths one will go to protect family.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates incredible growth by arriving at Marineford with powerful allies, strategically using Crocodile's weakness against him, and fearlessly declaring his dream to Whitebeard. His determination to save Ace drives every action.
keyActions: Arrives at Marineford with Impel Down escapees
Stops Crocodile's attack on Whitebeard using Gear Second with water
Meets Whitebeard face-to-face for the first time
Boldly declares his intention to become Pirate King
Promises to save Ace regardless of the obstacles
quotes: If the giant old man was indeed Whitebeard, no one was touching him as the Emperor was the only person Ace truly cared about.
Don't tell me what to do! I'm going to become the Pirate King!
I'll do as I please, and I'll save Ace!

characterSpotlights.development: Whitebeard recognizes Luffy's straw hat and recalls Shanks' words about the New Age. He acknowledges Luffy's fearless spirit and tacitly accepts him as an ally in rescuing Ace, showing respect for the young pirate's determination.
keyActions: Recognizes Luffy's straw hat as belonging to Shanks
Recalls Shanks' statement about betting on the New Age
Tests Luffy's resolve with warnings about dying
Accepts Luffy's determination and allows him to pursue his own path

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe makes the momentous decision to formally resign from the Shichibukai, choosing his principles and loyalty to Whitebeard over his official position with the World Government.
keyActions: Helps Luffy and the escapees arrive at Marineford
Formally announces resignation from the Shichibukai to Sengoku
Commits fully to the rescue mission for Ace
quotes: Sengoku! I resign from my position as a Warlord of the Sea!

characterSpotlights.development: Ace's emotional reaction upon seeing Luffy shows his deep concern for his brother's safety and his guilt over being the cause of Luffy's dangerous mission.
keyActions: Calls out to Luffy in shock and concern

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile reveals that despite the temporary alliance, he still pursues his own agenda by attempting to assassinate Whitebeard, showing his treacherous and ambitious nature.
keyActions: Arrives at Marineford with the Impel Down escapees
Attempts a surprise attack on Whitebeard
Gets stopped by Luffy's water-enhanced Gear Second kick

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, Doflamingo's statement about all current and former Warlords being present contains an error, as Blackbeard remained at Impel Down and was not at Marineford at this point.
The character Candre appears in the manga during Marine reactions but was replaced with a nameless Marine in the anime adaptation.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 557 of the manga, titled 'Luffy and Whitebeard'.
Episode 466 has an exceptionally high rating of 9.4/10 on IMDB with over 4,300 votes, making it one of the highest-rated episodes in the entire series.
This is the first time Luffy uses water to counter Crocodile's sand abilities since their battle in Alabasta, showing his strategic memory and growth.
Luffy's arrival marks the first successful mass breakout in Impel Down's history, with 240+ prisoners escaping.
This episode features one of the most iconic moments in One Piece: Luffy declaring he will become Pirate King directly to Whitebeard, one of the Four Emperors.
The opening theme 'One day' by The Rootless was used from Episode 459 to Episode 492, covering much of the Marineford Arc.
Like most One Piece episodes from Episode 279 to Episode 1070, this episode did not have an ending theme.
